0.user_question: James buys a plane.  The plane cost $150,000.  He pays $8578246 a month to rent a hanger to keep it in.  He also spends twice as much as that on fuel per month.  How much did it cost him to get and maintain the plane for the first year?

ost_step.2: Each month he rents a hanger which costs $8578246 (This seems like an error; let’s assume this was meant to say $8,578).
ost_step.3: Renting expenses annually would then be $8,578 * 12 months = $102,936.
ost_step.4: Fuel costs double his monthly hanger rent so each month he spends $8,578 * 2 = $17,156 on fuel. Annual fuel costs therefore equal $17,156 * 12 months = $205,872.

direct_answer.text:

Initial Cost Price of Plane : $150,000
Hanger Monthly Expense : $8,578 ($Correction made)

Fuel Consumption Monthly Amount: $17,156 (=Double of previous amount mentioned due to correction )
Annual Fuel Cost: $17,156*12=$205,872
Total Initial & Maintenance cost over First Year: $150,000+$102,936+$205,872='total_cost'.
So finally we calculate 'total_cost': $150,000+ $102,936+$205,872= $458,808
Accordingly Total initial purchase price plus maintenance including refuelling charges over a period of One full year equals $$458,808 . That means

0.user_question: James buys a plane.  The plane cost $150,000.  He pays $8578246 a month to rent a hanger to keep it in.  He also spends twice as much as that on fuel per month.  How much did it cost him to get and maintain the plane for the first year?

direct_answer.text: Let's think step by step. James paid $150,000 initially. Each rental costs $85,782.46 (rounded). That means over twelve months this would amount to 12*$85,782.46=£1,029,389.52 . Fuel was doubled compared to what he spent on planes so £85,782.46*2=$171,564.92 every month or £171,564.92*12=$2,056,779 a year. Combining everything together we see its worthwhile calculating all expenses into one figure. Adding them up you receive ($150,000+$1,029,389.52+$2,056,779) which equals roughly $$3,236,168.52 , meaning It’ll take about 2 years until maintenance fees match initial purchase price..
